Dimension.title: Dimension

website.description: a generic property to be used in classes that represent something which has a website

MolarConcentration.description: A quality inhering in a substance by virtue of the amount of the bearer's there is mixed with another substance. [Wikipedia:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/concentration]
MolarConcentration.title: MolarConcentration

MolarityMeasurementDatum.description: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measuring the molarity (aka volume concentration) of a chemical solution.
MolarityMeasurementDatum.title: MolarityMeasurementDatum

MolarityUnit.title: MolarityUnit

NmrManufacturers.title: NmrManufacturers

local_id.description: This property should be used to provide the local identifier with which something is denoted in a local context (e.g. your lab notebook).

name.description: a generic property to provide a string that is used to name a something

smiles.description: The canocical SMILES of a compound (Sample, Solvent or Buffe)

manufactured_by.description: a property to be used on any class that represents some form of atrefact, in order to refer to the artefacts maker.

NmrSolution.description: A NMR sollution is the solution made up of the solvent in which the evaluated sample is dissolved in as well as possibly the buffer needed to adjust the pH value.

measured_molarity.description: The predicate needed to relate to the concentration of the NMR solution.

measured_pH.description: The predicate needed to relate to the concentration of the NMR solution.

name.description: a generic property to provide a string that is used to name a something

sample.description: The attribute needed to relate the NMR solution to its solvent.

solvent.description: The attribute needed to relate the NMR solution to its solvent.

NmrSolution.title: NmrSolution

name.description: a generic property to provide a string that is used to name a something

smiles.description: The canocical SMILES of a compound (Sample, Solvent or Buffe)

NmrSpecRecord.description: This is the tree root node of the schema. It is a data item that serves as a container for all relevant information about *one* NMR spectroscopy assay record. The properties of this class represent the required metadata of an NMR assay, such as:  * what kind of assay was performed (e.g. 2D 13C COSY) and what devices where used for that (e.g. spectrometer, magnet, solvent, buffer, ...) * what are the detail infos of the assayed sample (name, formula, structure, concentration, preperation process, ...)

date_created.description: The date on which the source file was processed according to this schema.

id.description: the URI of a NMR spectroscopy record. If a record does not have an URI, you must use "nmrSPARQL" as prefix and the filename (e.g. "nmrSPARQL:filename1.jdx") and an unresolvable URI will be minted upon ingest by replacing this prefix with the URI of the dataset.

licence_str.description: the licence of the ingested raw data as string

licence_url.description: the licence of the ingested raw data in machine readable format as URL

name.description: a generic property to provide a string that is used to name a something

source.description: This property is used to describe the source of the data as string (e.g. "Chemotion Repository", the file name of a record).

source_uri.description: This property can be used to provide the URL or CURIE of the the source file, if it has one.

NmrSpecRecord.title: NmrSpecRecord

NmrSpecRecordCollection.description: This class represents a collection of NMR spectroscopy records. It is to be used when multiple NMR assays were made in order to analyse a given sample.

assays_sample.description: This property is used to provide metadata on the assayed NMR sample.

date_created.description: The date on which the source file was processed according to this schema.

licence_str.description: the licence of the ingested raw data as string

licence_url.description: the licence of the ingested raw data in machine readable format as URL

name.description: a generic property to provide a string that is used to name a something

source.description: This property is used to describe the source of the data as string (e.g. "Chemotion Repository", the file name of a record).

source_uri.description: This property can be used to provide the URL or CURIE of the the source file, if it has one.

NmrSpecRecordCollection.title: NmrSpecRecordCollection

manufactured_by.description: a property to be used on any class that represents some form of atrefact, in order to refer to the artefacts maker.

type.description: This property represents the type of spectrometer used in the NMR assay as string. Often this information will not be present in the JCAMP-DX file, but it can be parsed from Brucker source files

PhMeasurementDatum.description: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measuring the pH value of a chemical solution.
PhMeasurementDatum.title: PhMeasurementDatum

PulseProgram.description: Enum of the most commonly used pulse sequences that specify the type of pulsed NMR. Based on a mix of Bruker specs (https://pharm.ucsf.edu/sites/pharm.ucsf.edu/files/Pulse%20Program%20Catalog%201%20%281D%20and%202D%20Experiments%29.pdf), IUPAC specs (http://www.jcamp-dx.org/protocols/NMR%20Pulse%20Sequences%20PAC%2079(11)%20pp1748-1764%202001.pdf) and JEOL specs (https://www.uh.edu/nsm/chemistry/resources/nmr/ECAXSII_Advanced_Mode_Tutorial_Manual.pdf)
PulseProgram.title: PulseProgram

acquisition_nuclei.description: the nuclei to be assayed as specified by the protocol

assay_date.description: the date the assay was carried out by someone

name.description: a generic property to provide a string that is used to name a something

pulse_program.description: The pulse program of a PulsedNmrAssay is a required property and must be conform to one of the values defined in the PulseProgram enum class. The possible values there are defined according to common pulse programs, e.g. NMR for basic 1H-NMR, or COSY and COSY-DOSY, etc.

pulse_program_custom.description: A custom pulse program specification that is not yet in our list of allowed values for the pulse program parameter.

solution.description: the property refering to solution in which the assayed sample is disolved in

TemperatureMeasurementDatum.description: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measuring temperature.
TemperatureMeasurementDatum.title: TemperatureMeasurementDatum
